Have you been contacted by an Essay Mill Service offering to write your assessments for a money?

These companies are illegal in the UK, and using them can result in you being subject to disciplinary action including being withdrawn from your course! üò∞

They may offer to help take the stress off by doing your work for a 'cheap price', but often they blackmail students asking for more money and most of the time the work produced really isn't as great as what you could produce yourself!

If you are contacted by these services, please email, Unionadvice@city.ac.uk and we can assist with getting that company email blocked from City accounts. 

Do not give them any personal information or contact details.

If things get too tough and you need support with assessments you can:
- talk to Academic Skills
- submit an Extenuating Circumstances form
- speak with your Module Lead or Personal Tutor
- Get support from the Library

üí°If something goes wrong during these August resits, remember you can submit an Extenuating Circumstances claim for another attempt.

Just remember...
üü†EC‚Äôs must be submitted within 7 days of the assessment deadline! (If it is late you will have to appeal which is harder)
üü†EC‚Äôs are for circumstances unforeseen and outside of your control

There are different types of EC‚Äôs and points to consider:

Self certification - A short term illness that lasted no more than 7 months days. No evidence needed but you can only make two of these claims in an academic year.

EC with evidence - For Illnesses lasting more than 7 days and personal circumstances outside of your control. If you can‚Äôt get evidence in time for the deadline, then you can include ‚Äúthe evidence is to follow‚Äù in your application. - Evidence must be certified translated if in another language

EC without evidence - It must be reasonably impossible for you to obtain evidence and you‚Äôll need to provide an explanation as to why you can‚Äôt get evidence

For further info check out the SU‚Äôs self help guide on submitting an EC by clicking the link in our bio!

üß° We had the most amazing launch event yesterday! 

It was lovely to see you all and talk about how we‚Äôre switching things up with the new strategy. 

Our three main promises are:

Promise 1: Creating Community - ‚ÄòCreating a thriving community where every student feels they belong.‚Äô 

Promise 2: Delivering Change - ‚ÄòDelivering the changes students want to see to improve their everyday lives at City.‚Äô 

Promise 3: Providing Support - ‚ÄòProviding high quality and easily accessible support whilst at City and beyond.‚Äô

"Heart of Light was imagined for the month of February, the last month of winter, a distinctive colour lingering on the horizon giving us the impression something new is coming. Light has a central place in the ideas behind all the music.

Finbar Hosie‚Äôs new work The Hyacinth Garden invites us on a political and sensuous exploration through waste lands and gardens, in search of togetherness and separation in space and sound. Noriko Baba‚Äôs Bonbori is a sound painting of the beauty of Japanese lacquerware glimmering in candlelight in a dark room. Mic Spencer‚Äôs new piece, nuthin lik disperr, part of his love letters cycle, is inspired by the poem of the same name by Tom Leonard, an ode to the joy of metaphorical darkness. Santiago D√≠ez Fischer‚Äôs love fragments takes Sappho‚Äôs fragments on love and desire as the starting point, beginning with the line, ‚ÄúYou Burn me‚Äù and is part of a new album to be released in the Spring of 2023 documenting his work with lovemusic. Finally in Sasha Blondeau‚Äôs Sortir du noir (title "stolen" from Georges Didi-Huberman‚Äôs book of the same name) two types of light collide - strong and intentional (roaming searchlights) with fleeting and inadvertent (lamps of lost people). 

@collective_lovemusic @micspencer1 @finhosie @sasha.j.blondeau

Black Pound Day encourages everyone to spend money at Black owned businesses and helps to inform communities on how they can better support Black businesses.
